filmography.title: Romance on the High Seas
filmography.role_description: A cabaret singer who poses as a wealthy socialite on a cruise ship, leading to romantic entanglements and mistaken identities; Day's film debut.
filmography.plot: A singer poses as a socialite on a cruise to Rio, where she falls for a detective hired by the socialite's husband.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Original Song ('It's Magic')

filmography.title: My Dream Is Yours
filmography.role_description: A young widow and aspiring singer who is discovered by a talent agent and rises to radio stardom.
filmography.plot: A talent scout tries to make a star out of a young mother he hears singing on a jukebox.

filmography.title: It's a Great Feeling
filmography.role_description: A starstruck waitress at the Warner Bros. commissary who is 'discovered' by Jack Carson and Dennis Morgan.
filmography.plot: Two actors try to find a director for their new movie while helping a waitress become a star.

filmography.title: Tea for Two
filmography.role_description: A wealthy flapper who bets her uncle she can say 'no' to everything for 24 hours in order to fund a Broadway show.
filmography.plot: A wealthy girl wants to be a star in her boyfriend's show, but she has to win a bet with her uncle first.

filmography.title: Lullaby of Broadway
filmography.role_description: A singer who returns to New York to visit her mother, unaware that her mother's Broadway career has faded.
filmography.plot: A young woman comes to New York to visit her mother, a faded Broadway star who is pretending to be successful.

filmography.title: On Moonlight Bay
filmography.role_description: A tomboyish girl in small-town Indiana who falls for the boy next door in this nostalgic musical.
filmography.plot: The tomboy daughter of a banker falls for a college student moving into the neighborhood.

filmography.title: By the Light of the Silvery Moon
filmography.role_description: Reprising her role as Marjorie, she navigates family chaos and romance after her boyfriend returns from WWI.
filmography.plot: The Winfield family deals with post-WWI adjustments as Marjorie's boyfriend returns from the war.

filmography.title: Calamity Jane
filmography.role_description: The rough-and-tumble frontierswoman who learns to embrace her femininity while falling for Wild Bill Hickok.
filmography.plot: Calamity Jane is a rough-riding cowgirl who tries to bring a famous actress to Deadwood but brings her maid instead.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Secret Love')

filmography.title: Young at Heart
filmography.role_description: A wholesome girl who leaves her steady fiancé for a cynical, brooding musician played by Frank Sinatra.
filmography.plot: A cynical musician enters the lives of a musical family and disrupts the romance of one of the daughters.

filmography.title: Love Me or Leave Me
filmography.role_description: The real-life 1920s torch singer whose rise to fame is manipulated by a possessive gangster husband.
filmography.plot: The career of singer Ruth Etting is boosted by a gangster who demands she repay him with marriage.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Motion Picture Story; Oscar: Nomination – Best Original Song

filmography.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
filmography.role_description: A retired singer whose son is kidnapped in Morocco to prevent her and her husband from revealing an assassination plot.
filmography.plot: An American family vacationing in Morocco stumbles upon an assassination plot, leading to their son's kidnapping.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Que Sera, Sera')

filmography.title: Julie
filmography.role_description: A flight attendant who discovers her jealous husband murdered her first husband and is now targeting her.
filmography.plot: A stewardess is terrorized by her jealous husband and must land a plane when the pilots are incapacitated.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Original Song; Oscar: Nomination – Best Original Screenplay

filmography.title: The Pajama Game
filmography.role_description: A grievance committee head at a pajama factory who falls for the new superintendent despite a looming strike.
filmography.plot: Union and management clash at a pajama factory, but romance blossoms between the grievance committee head and the superintendent.

filmography.title: Teacher's Pet
filmography.role_description: A journalism professor who unwittingly falls for a gruff newspaper editor posing as a student in her class.
filmography.plot: A hard-nosed newspaper editor poses as a student in a journalism class to prove that experience is better than education.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Gig Young)

filmography.title: The Tunnel of Love
filmography.role_description: A suburban wife struggling to adopt a baby while dealing with her husband's suspected infidelity.
filmography.plot: A couple goes through trials and tribulations while trying to adopt a baby.

filmography.title: It Happened to Jane
filmography.role_description: A lobster farmer in Maine who takes on a railroad tycoon after his negligence ruins her shipment.
filmography.plot: A small-town lobster farmer sues a railroad tycoon when her shipment is ruined, engaging in a David vs. Goliath battle.
filmography.awards: Notable Comedy Pairing with Jack Lemmon

filmography.title: Pillow Talk
filmography.role_description: An interior decorator forced to share a party line with a womanizing songwriter, leading to a romantic rivalry.
filmography.plot: A womanizing songwriter and an interior decorator share a telephone party line and despise each other, until he poses as a Texan to woo her.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Oscar: Win – Best Original Screenplay

filmography.title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
filmography.role_description: A wife and mother who moves her family to the country while her drama critic husband stays in the city.
filmography.plot: A drama critic and his family move to the country, where he struggles with his new job and she struggles with the house.

filmography.title: Midnight Lace
filmography.role_description: An American heiress living in London who is terrorized by threatening phone calls and a stalker.
filmography.plot: A newlywed American woman in London is threatened by a stalker, but no one believes her.

filmography.title: Lover Come Back
filmography.role_description: An advertising executive who competes with a rival who uses unethical methods to win clients.
filmography.plot: An advertising executive uses a non-existent product to secure a client, but his female rival tries to expose him.

filmography.title: That Touch of Mink
filmography.role_description: An unemployed woman who is wooed by a wealthy businessman with an offer of a luxurious affair.
filmography.plot: A rich businessman courts a woman with a trip to Bermuda, but she wants marriage while he only wants an affair.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Comedy Motion Picture

filmography.title: Billy Rose's Jumbo
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a circus owner who fights to save her father's show from a rival circus takeover.
filmography.plot: A circus owner's daughter tries to save her father's show from being taken over by a rival, unaware that the new hire is the rival's son.

filmography.title: The Thrill of It All
filmography.role_description: A housewife who becomes an overnight celebrity as a TV commercial spokesperson, upsetting her obstetrician husband.
filmography.plot: A housewife becomes a TV soap spokesperson, causing tension with her husband who feels neglected.

filmography.title: Move Over, Darling
filmography.role_description: A woman declared dead after a plane crash who returns home five years later to find her husband remarried.
filmography.plot: A woman missing for five years returns home on the day her husband is marrying another woman.

filmography.title: Send Me No Flowers
filmography.role_description: The wife of a hypochondriac who mistakenly believes he is dying and tries to find her a new husband.
filmography.plot: A hypochondriac believes he is dying and tries to find a new husband for his wife without telling her.

filmography.title: The Glass Bottom Boat
filmography.role_description: A widow who works in public relations for a space lab and is mistaken for a Soviet spy.
filmography.plot: A woman who works at a space lab is mistaken for a Russian spy by her boss, who tries to catch her in the act.

filmography.title: Caprice
filmography.role_description: An industrial designer who gets caught up in international espionage while investigating her father's death.
filmography.plot: An industrial designer gets involved in a spy plot involving cosmetics companies and narcotics smuggling.

filmography.title: With Six You Get Eggroll
filmography.role_description: A widow with three sons who marries a widower with a daughter, leading to blended family chaos; Day's final film.
filmography.plot: A widow and a widower marry and try to blend their families, facing resistance from their children and dogs.
